storyInfo: Medic Operator Hibiscus does more than treat patients on her first field mission.

attributes.content: What is it this time, Hibiscus? I've humored you and gotten the checkup. You do what you do with the other workers.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: It's not about the physical screening! You have to be here today, Mr. Gali!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Stop pulling my sleeve, I've got to fill the boss's orders...
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Hey! Gimme back my keys!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I finally found an expert who can come in and help find out why everyone in the workshop's conditions have been flaring up with no rhyme or reason!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I'm not giving you back your keys unless you cooperate!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Hey, stop it, you brat!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Take it easy, Hibiscus... What's the matter, Gali? Have you eaten yet?
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: Wallen? Stop her!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: There's no use hiding behind him!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Yeah, you can't hide now that I've gotten skinnier!
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: Remember to watch what you eat so you don't regain all that excess body fat!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I know, I know.
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: What happened to the guy who used to complain about the annoying new doctor? Still can't believe Hibiscus managed to win your stubborn ass over.
attributes.name: Humorous Worker

attributes.content: You askin' for a fist to the face? Hibiscus, I caught him drinking beer last night, all those empty cans...
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: Hey now! Don't listen to him!
attributes.name: Nervous Worker

attributes.content: Well, I've been monitoring everyone's vitals... Once should be fine, I guess, but don't do it again!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: ...You sure are patient. The doctors from the last hospital couldn't wait to get away from here once they saw a bunch of Infected.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: No wonder the patient records were full of errors. We should continue to work together, Mr. Gali. Rhodes Island treats the Infected with care and attention!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Fine, fine, I'll think about it. Just gimme back my car keys.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Huh? That's a completely different matter! The expert still hasn't...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I know, I know, it's your first mission, you want to look good. Don't worry, I'll put in a good word with your supervisor.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: That's not the problem, Mr. Gali! I really do suspect that—
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Well, look at that, a personal welcome from the boss?
What are you doing here in the middle of the day, dressed like that? Do all government employees have this much free time?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I guess the rumors of you mellowing out have been greatly exaggerated. I'm not here to argue.
Then... Hey, what's that equipment on your back? It's not time for the annual inspection yet! Besides, you're not who handles our inspections—
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Forgot to take your meds or something? You think I'd have come on my own without being asked?
Are you Mr. Edgar?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Wait, don't tell me this guy is the expert you were talking about?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Mr. Gali! Mr. Gali! I...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: One second.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Yes, I'll take care of the rest... Bye.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: The results are in. The safety equipment is really worn-out, with lots of cracks in the isolation shell. No wonder the workers keep getting sick.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Folks from the Engineering Department tell me this part is out of production, and that it'd be cheaper to just buy a new machine.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: A new machine, eh?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I know it's not cheap, but the workers will never get better in this environment.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Alright, we'll get it replaced.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: ...Really?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: If a few quid is all it takes. We're all old neighbors from the slums.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Thank you! But it might take more than a few quid... here's the catalogue.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: ...You could buy half my workshop with that kind of cash!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Well, there's also this.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: An industrial equipment subsidy... did you get that from Edgar?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I understand that you might have some history with him, but these are all official documents, and I added comments where the legalese gets confusing.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I can even fill out the form for you, if you're busy. All you'll need to do is review it before signing.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I see... Oh, Hibiscus, your office just called. They want you to go back.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Huh? Why would they call you?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I was so busy I didn't even realize that the contract expired half a month ago. I'll work out your pay...
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: No need for that, Mr. Gali! I'm here as a volunteer!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: No, but...
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: It's okay, really! I was planning to stay a little longer anyway. I'll talk to the head office.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Cleaning up the workshop, installing the new equipment, plus the necessary safety training... All that will take at least a month. You'll be short-handed.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Once the new equipment is ready, I'll also need to follow-up with everyone, to make sure there's no rebound—
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: It's okay, Hibiscus. You've done enough.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Do you have a lot of stuff? I can take the car out.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: ...Are you having problems, Mr. Gali?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: If money is the issue, I can help you apply for a medication subsidy that all factories that employ Infected are eligible for.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Don't try to take on everything alone! It's okay to accept help from others once in a while. And I could introduce you to—
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: For heaven's sake, could you just stop?! Has it never occurred to you that you're my biggest problem?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: What do you...?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Do you know how much delay your checkups have caused? My phone's been ringing for two days straight with all the people demanding to know when their orders will be ready!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I... I'm sorry, Mr. Gali, I didn't know the factory was so backlogged. But I've adjusted the treatment plan...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Enough. I know you want to look good, to feel like you've accomplished something on your first mission.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: But first you called Edgar here, and now you want to me stop working and replace my equipment? Everyone could be out on the streets starving by tomorrow!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: ...Are you that concerned that you won't be able to deliver on time? Don't worry, I've looked it up!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Work delays due to equipment repair and replacement are eligible for city subsidies, legal relief, and health subsidies... for up to a month.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Mr. Edgar said that the facility is eligible for an equipment subsidy that will cut the out-of-pocket expense for new machines in half!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Enough! Edgar this, Edgar that! Do you even know who he is? Do you know which noble holds the leash on his collar?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Little factories like us can't afford to miss a deadline. Health subsidies? They'll just end up in somebody else's pocket!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I-I'll get it cleared up, make sure everything is actually in order...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Get back here! Do you still not get it?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Every time you do any of this shit, someone learns about it, and those nobles take another bloody cut out of my pocket!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: No wonder there were new inspection stamps on the aging machines... No wonder the supervisor at the city council looked confused when I brought him the files...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Your factory isn't licensed, is it? It's a private sweatshop employed by nobles.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Yes! Do you finally get it? The best thing you can do for me is pack your stuff and get your ass back to that Rhodes Island!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Okay, I'll go, but there's one last thing I want to check first.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Are the results from the previous hospital's checkups accurate, or were they fudged?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Because I don't see how such mild symptoms could deteriorate so much in just a year.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: It's not a problem with the data, is it? It's the work... you made them trade their lives for money, didn't you?!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: So what if I did? Their lives would be worth even less if I didn't get them these jobs! Where do you think we are, Londinium?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: How many boots do you think I had to lick just to hire the Infected? All so I could take on orders the uninfected workers wouldn't touch with a 10 foot pole!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Are you guys arguing?
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: No, just talking... About work.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Whatever. Edgar came back and went around the workshop measuring stuff. And something about taking half a month off?
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: Would those big companies even agree to that when we haven't finished their orders? ...Hey, why aren't you guys saying anything? What's going on, Gali?
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: Just get back to work, Wallen. I'll take care of it.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: You'll take care of it... Kid, we're sick, not dying. Don't try to take everything on yourself.
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: If the factory's having trouble... you can always take on more orders. We can handle it.
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: Wallen...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Don't worry, I'll let you know if I ever really need help.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Alright, then come and get your grub when you're done here. We saved plenty of meat for you.
attributes.name: Wallen

attributes.content: ...They knew?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: They're Infected, not stupid. The only way they can live a better life is to make the most of their already-infected bodies.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: But that's only because they don't have a choice. It doesn't mean they have to just sit and take it. It doesn't mean they can't have hope for the future!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Hope? You kidding me?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Do you expect the fat bastards above us to suddenly grow a conscience and start handing out money? Or the workers to eat your bland-ass food every day until they're sick to death of it?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: When you don't have long to live, might as well use that time to earn some cash and make life better now.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: ...Do you really think that's what they want?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Wallen exercises every day, Bard has virtually quit drinking, and Elsa has put away her cigarettes after smoking all her life.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Do you really think they don't care about living longer?!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: The Infected have the right to be healthy too. They may be willing to give it up for their livelihood, or for their children—
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But that's no excuse to expose them to dangerous work, or use them as a trading chip for your profits!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Are you done yet?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Will anything you're saying get me new machines and new jobs that are completely risk-free?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I've done plenty. The stones aren't bloody growing on me. No one forced me to deal with Infected workers, or to put up with your crap.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Now get outta here. I've got work to do.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Gali? You got the files?
attributes.name: Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: ...Whatever the nobles behind you are thinking, Edgar, whether they want money or the factory, this is between us. Don't drag a little girl into this.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Hey! What are you—
attributes.name: Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Suppressant dosage and usage guide, protection equipment manual... and a checklist for machine safety devices.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Whoa, would you look at that? Hibiscus, of all people, staying up late?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Closure?! Already? How did you...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You thought I'd ignore a late-night request from our little Hibiscus? I've already approved your application for discounted suppressants.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: ...Thanks.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: As for the private message you sent... Well, it's not like I can't pull some strings to get a sweet discount on this type of equipment...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I just wanted to double-check that you really think this is necessary.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I... I just think that Mr. Gali really does care about his employees.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: So if a discount can change his mind, then maybe all the changes in mindset and improvements in health I've worked so hard for will actually take root.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I know Rhodes Island has no obligation to do whatever I ask, but—
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: That's not what I meant.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What I meant is we're not talking pocket change, even with a discount. Are you gonna spend years worth of your own salary to buy him the machines if he doesn't agree?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Of course not! My job is just to make one final check on everyone's behalf, and make sure they know what they need to know.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: My powers are limited, but I want to at least do what I can, try to push a little further. That last push may be all that's needed for real change.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Who's sending me work messages at this hour? I'm gonna sue their pants off... Edgar?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Didn't you tell me to send him home because of his feud with the factory owner? What now...?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: They just keep coming! What's wrong with him?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: They aren't for you, Closure. I linked the monitoring bracelet notifications to the terminal.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Why are you still here? Is your ride not here yet?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: There's... something I wanted to confirm with you. Were you checking on the machines in the workshop last night?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You were monitoring me?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: You left in a hurry after yesterday's checkup and didn't take off your bracelet. I got a notification on my terminal about abnormal Originium activity.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Ah, forgot about that. Here.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Now get going if you're done. I was just making sure Edgar didn't mess with anything... What's the matter?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I... I ran an imaging scan last night, which showed a Blood Originium-Crystal Density of 0.2u/L... the same as when I was diagnosed with Oripathy.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: ...What do you mean?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Have you ever considered the possibility that you've been... infected?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Are you kidding me? There must be something wrong with your equipment. I never go in the workshop without my protective suit. You have any idea how much that cost me?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: You bought your suit from the hospital you worked with before, didn't you?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Yeah, what about it?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Why would you trust a doctor who can't even screen properly out of fear of the Infected to take their preventative measures seriously?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: ...You're talking crap! I always see the best doctors for my checkups!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: And if I'm really Infected, why don't I feel anything? Show me the report! Damn it... what's with all these figures and diagrams?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: It's the estimated growth trend of your Blood Originium-Crystal Density. Mr. Wallen told me that the high-risk work began last March. Working off your current data...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: No! This can't be happening to me!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Look at all this medicine! It wasn't cheap getting it delivered from Columbia! I've been taking it for so long, I should've developed resistance to it!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: ...Say something! The report's fake, right? So that I'll buy your products?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Mr. Gali, please, calm down...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: And just tell me while you're at it...
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: What's with that look on your face? You're laughing at me, aren't you? Stop looking at me like that!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I said, stop looking at me like that! You're happy that I'm Infected, aren't you? You think it's karma that I'm joining your little Infected family?!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: ...I'd never wish that on anyone, no matter how much I dislike them. The uninfected can never understand the pain faced by the Infected.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I don't need your preaching! I'm not gonna become trash like you people, even if I'm Infected!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: My factory... I have enough money to pay for treatment for the rest of my life! I... I...
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I haven't even left this bloody place yet... There's still so much I had to do...
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Dammit all, I don't want to die...
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: No one does. But it takes a lot of effort just to live. And courage, to keep one's desires in check. And to do all you can to live a better life, no matter how dire the situation.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: There is nothing funny about what you believe are futile efforts.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Once the rocks show up, I won't be able to negotiate with those people anymore... I'll have to find someone else to take over the factory. The fires have to stay lit.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: It's not a matter of a few days... How long can I keep living like a normal person, if I do things your way?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: ...For a long time. Congratulations.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Congratulations?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: You're very fortunate. While your crystal density has passed the pathological threshold, you haven't developed any symptoms.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Which means you're not technically Infected yet. Your condition will improve as long as you stay away from sources of infection, wear proper protection, and receive appropriate treatment.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: ...This isn't a joke, right?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: It's not. You're one step away from full-blown Oripathy, and you should be wary of the organizations that you used to work with.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: As for why I didn't tell you this right off the bat... I wanted you to know how the Infected feel.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: ...I don't need you to tell me! I know their situation better than you do!
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I thought you might have forgotten.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: The people here see you as a kid from the slums who made it big and gave back to his old neighborhood.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Even as their health and circumstances deteriorate, all they ever talk about is how hard things are for you, and how they can help you cut costs.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: They can hardly make ends meet themselves...
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: I don't believe that someone they all trust and care for so much is only doing this to exploit them.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: 'It's okay if the equipment is a little old; it's okay to take a few more orders...'
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Those kinds of thoughts are like the crystals in your bloodstream, rising to the surface whenever they accumulate. And they must be prevented, just like Oripathy.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Here are the subsidy application forms from Rhodes Island, including suppressants and the equipment that needs to be replaced. The channels are plenty discreet.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Our relationship is just client and contractor. Whatever decision you make from here on is none of my business.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But at least try not to let those people down.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Alright, my ride is here. Goodbye, Mr. Gali.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Wait, the forms you brought... Let's talk about them. And I want to speak to your supervisor too—
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Stop rushing me, dammit! You in a rush to go to hell or something?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Gali! I've got your stuff here! Now come out of your room!
Put it over here, it'll make it easy to move that machine. Hey, this cord isn't the original, is it?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I should ask the office to send a proper engineer... Hey, wear your gloves properly!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: ...So which bigshot ordered you to bring in all these new machines?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Did it ever occur to you that maybe I was moved by her sincere pleas and found a conscience?
attributes.name: Edgar

attributes.content: I might've believed it five years ago.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Yes, and I know you still hold a grudge ever since I withdrew my investment and took a job for a noble on the city council, but I needed money for my dad's treatment.
attributes.name: Edgar

attributes.content: Spare me, that's none of my business.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Well, whatever you say... It was the higher-ups who forced these orders for military parts on you, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Edgar

attributes.content: ...How did you know?
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Someone would've swallowed up this little factory of yours a long time ago if I didn't.
attributes.name: Edgar

attributes.content: You should take on some normal orders now that you've got the new machines. I've already talked to the guy at the city council who handles factory licenses.
attributes.name: Edgar

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Gali

attributes.content: Mr. Wallen? I said we didn't need your help! The equipment testing is bad for your health! Shoo!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Me? I'm alright, I'm wearing protective gear, and I can use Arts... Fine, I'll go with you!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: The number you are calling is currently unavailable. Please leave a message after the tone.
Hibiscus! I've called you three times already! How long is this gonna take, seriously? The guys from A1 are gonna break down my door if you don't get back to me!
Anyway, I wanted to say it's really impressive how you got the situation under control in such a short time. And on your first field mission, too. You even got Edgar to buy the new machines.
Patience, professionalism, sticking to your guns, predicting the client's needs... We should work together on a business venture some time.
Seriously though, come back soon! We're holding a party to celebrate your success and we need the guest of honor!
